dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to the podcast, everyone! Uh, we've got some absolutely massive news in the combat sports world. B, you seeing this Alvarez deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to the podcast, everyone! Uh, we've got some absolutely massive news in the combat sports world. B, you seeing this Alvarez deal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I'm seeing it, A. It's, like, mind-boggling. We're talking a minimum of $365 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I'm seeing it, A. It's, like, mind-boggling. We're talking a minimum of three hundred sixty five million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Three hundred and sixty-five million! That's just... that's insane. What is that, like, per fight?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Three hundred and sixty-five million! That's just... that's insane. What is that, like, per fight?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the reports are saying it averages out to about $33 million per fight. It's just, uh, unheard of.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the reports are saying it averages out to about thirty three million dollars per fight. It's just, uh, unheard of.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he's already got his first couple of fights lined up, right? Rocky Fielding in December?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's already got his first couple of fights lined up, right? Rocky Fielding in December?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alvarez will kick off his DAZN deal December 15 at Madison Square Garden against Rocky Fielding, and then likely fight again in early May for a Cinco de Mayo match.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right, and then a big Cinco de Mayo show, likely in May. With endorsements, he's looking at, like, $120 million just in the next twelve months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right, and then a big Cinco de Mayo show, likely in May. With endorsements, he's looking at, like, one hundred twenty million dollars just in the next twelve months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alvarez will kick off his DAZN deal December 15 at Madison Square Garden against Rocky Fielding, and then likely fight again in early May for a Cinco de Mayo match. With the two DAZN fights, plus roughly $50 million for his razor-thin win over Gennady Golovkin last month and several million dollars from endorsements, Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, Forbes' highest-paid athlete list next year, he's gotta be a shoe-in, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, Forbes highest-paid athlete list next year, he's gotta be a shoe-in, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. He's got a really strong chance to top that list. It's a huge moment for the sport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. He's got a really strong chance to top that list. It's a huge moment for the sport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Mexican boxer has a strong chance to rank as the worlds highest-paid athlete next year in Forbes annual look at the top stars in sports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, speaking of big moments, we know HBO kind of bowed out of the boxing game recently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, speaking of big moments, we know H B O kind of bowed out of the boxing game recently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But HBO announced last month that it would end its coverage of boxing at the end of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, after setting the standard for, like, over 40 years. Alvarez was their biggest pay-per-view draw after Floyd Mayweather retired.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, after setting the standard for, like, over forty years. Alvarez was their biggest pay-per-view draw after Floyd Mayweather retired.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The premium cable network had set the standard for televising the sport for more than four decades, and its pay-per-view arm featured many of boxing's biggest stars... HBO was the former home for Alvarez, who ranks as the biggest pay-per-view star in the sport after the retirement of Floyd Mayweather.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, DAZN swooped in, huh? They're making a real push.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, D A Z N swooped in, huh? They're making a real push.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They really are. They launched in the US last month and they've gone big on combat sports. They signed that huge Matchroom Boxing deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They really are. They launched in the U S last month and they've gone big on combat sports. They signed that huge Matchroom Boxing deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: DAZN, which debuted two years ago in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Japan, launched in the U.S. last month and is making a major push in combat sports. It signed an eight-year, $1 billion deal in May with Eddie Hearns Matchroom Boxing, home of heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and this Alvarez deal just, it just cements them, doesn't it? Like, it's a statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and this Alvarez deal just, it just cements them, doesn't it? Like, it's a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. When you look at comparable deals, like Mayweather's old Showtime deal, that was around $200 million guaranteed. This blows that out of the water.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. When you look at comparable deals, like Mayweather's old Showtime deal, that was around two hundred million dollars guaranteed. This blows that out of the water.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only comparable deal in boxing history was the six-fight pactMayweather signed with Showtime in 2013. It guaranteed around $200 million, on par with Alvarez's per-fight average.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Even against, like, Giancarlo Stanton, the baseball player, or even soccer icons like Neymar and Messi?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even against, like, Giancarlo Stanton, the baseball player, or even soccer icons like Neymar and Messi?

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, those guys have huge deals too, around $350 million. But this Alvarez deal, it's just structured differently, uh, with that per-fight guarantee.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, those guys have huge deals too, around three hundred fifty million dollars. But this Alvarez deal, it's just structured differently, uh, with that per-fight guarantee.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global soccer icons Neymar and Lionel Messi both have deals worth roughly $350 million, with Neymars a five-year contract and Messis haul spread over four years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the race for the world's highest-paid athlete next year is gonna be intense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the race for the world's highest-paid athlete next year is gonna be intense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Messi was second this year, but with this kind of money, Alvarez is definitely in the conversation. It's a new era.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Messi was second this year, but with this kind of money, Alvarez is definitely in the conversation. It's a new era.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Messi will likely be Alvarezs biggest competition for the title of worlds highest-paid athlete. He ranked second on this year's list at $111 million, behind only Mayweather.
